oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grace Episcopal Church: Detail of stained glass window
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of one of three original stained glass windows. This particular window contains an etched design including crosses that the other two do not.

Grace Episcopal Church was established in 1877 with the completion of the church building. It was constructed by P.J. Williamson in the Carpenter Gothic style along Main Street in Spring Hill at a cost of $1800.00 funded by members of the church and friends from the community.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Churches -- Tennessee; Stained glass windows
Episcopal churches; Stained glass
